msContents.summary: Summary statement from the government bank at Theadelphia of receipts from poll-tax and "merismoi" during the first accounting period of the year; the names are in alphabetical order

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; on the back there is P.Col. V 1 verso 3
This document was a summary statement of the bank; unlike in P.Col. 1 recto 2, names and payment were entered at the same time
Double check lines are drawn next to a name when the amount was paid
The use of the month name Hadrianos instead of Choiak indicates that the text was written after 130 AD
The pig tax appears only when a man had died during the year
10 cols. of writing by the same small and practiced hand throughout: 31 lines in col. 1; 31 in col. 2; 34 in col. 3; 34 in col. 5; 28 in col. 6; 27 in col. 7; 30 in col. 8; 29 in col 9; 27 in col. 10

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 1,5 (Lot II) in Bell's inventory
